description.narrative: The project development objective is to reduce environmental degradation and potential risks for human health through the improved management of health care waste in Vietnam's hospitals.

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.1 | Description :The Recipient shall maintain throughout the duration of Projectimplementation a Steering Committee within MOH with composition andterm of reference satisfactory to the Association. | Frequency:Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.2 | Description :The Recipient shall maintain throughout the duration of Projectimplementation the Central Project Management Unit within MOH. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.4 | Description :The Recipient shall establish by no later than Oct 1, 2011, andmaintain throughout the duration of Project implementation a Technical Advisory Group. | Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.5 | Description :The Recipient shall, by no later than forty five (45) days after theEffective Date, retain the services of the Independent Verification Agencies for the duration of Project implementation. |Frequency :Yearly

Finance Agreement :Schedule 2, Section I.A.8 | Description :The Recipient shall, by no later than sixty (60) days after theEffective Date, enter into Grant Agreement with at least five (5) Beneficiaries | Due Date :31-Oct-2011

title.narrative: Reduce number of hospitals in black list issued in the Decision 1788 by Prime Minister
Improved perception among communities adjacent to project hospitals about health waste being properly managed
The number of new or revised policies, regulatory documents adopted and applied HCWM studies published and disseminated
Number of hospitals meeting: (a) wastewater standards; (b) solid waste standards; (c) HCWM practice standard
Number of HCW treatment system operators trained and passed the final test
Number of hospital meeting HCWM practice standards
Increased share of hospitals' wastewater meeting the environmental standards
Increased share of properly segregated and treated infectious health care waste
Number of leaders of health, DONRE, Environment Police, other agencies trained and passed the final test
Number of HCWM administrators in DOH, health care facilities, preventive health centers trained and passed the final test
Number of technical staff in environment monitoring agency trained and passed the final test
Number of trainers trained passing the final test
Number of Policy and administrative documents
Improved knowledge and skills of key health personnel in health care waste management standards and practices
Number of hospitals meeting wastewater standards
Number of Health Care Waste Management Plans approved by regulatory authority
Number of hospitals meeting solid waste treatment standards
Effective CPMU and TAG support to Component 2 beneficiaries
Increased number of health care staff following correct occupational safety practices, including usage of personal protective equipment
Progress reports and audit reports are submitted with satisfactory quality and timely manner
